name: Green Tea Enzyme Vitamin C Brightening Serum
about: What it is: A brightening serum with Vitamin C and enzymes from Green Tea that helps fade dark spots + post-breakout marks for a more even-toned complexion...Skin Type: Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily..Skincare Concerns: Dark Spots, Pores, and Dullness..Formulation: Lightweight Serum..Highlighted Ingredients:- Vitamin C/E + Ferulic Acid: Potent antioxidants that help brighten and fade dark spots + protect skin..- Green Tea-Derived Enzyme: Gently exfoliates and refines the look of skin texture..- Tangerine Peel Extract and Niacinamide: Even the look of skin tone and give skin extra radiance...Ingredient Callouts: Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance. It is also gluten-free, vegan, cruelty-free and comes in recyclable packaging...What Else You Need to Know: This serum's uniquely orange, floating capsules of Vitamin C quickly absorb into skin, visibly brightening & targeting dark spots like sunspots and post-breakout marks. It also features Green Tea enzyme, derived from our Korean Beauty Green Tea, that exfoliates and helps refine skin's texture...Clinical Results: Based on a clinical study and its self-assessment portion on 32 women ages 20 to 49,  after 1 week:.- Visibly improves tone in one week.- 100% saw brighter, clearer skin..After 4 weeks:.- 93% saw a more even complexion.- 90% saw diminished dark spots.- Diminishes dark spots in four weeks
ingredients: -Vitamin C and E and Ferulic Acid: Potent antioxidants that visibly brighten and fade dark spots..-Green Tea-Derived Enzyme: Gently exfoliates and refines the look of skin texture..-Tangerine Peel Extract and Niacinamide: Even the look of skin tone and give skin extra radiance...Water/Aqua/Eau, Propanediol, 1,2-Hexanediol, Glycerin, 3-O-Ethyl Ascorbic Acid, Butylene Glycol, Lactobacillus Ferment Lysate, Squalane, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Dextrin, Acrylates/C10-30 Alkyl Acrylate Crosspolymer, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Tromethamine, Xanthan Gum, Gluconolactone, Citrus Reticulata (Tangerine) Peel Extract, Panthenol, Niacinamide, Allantoin, Daucus Carota Sativa (Carrot) Root Extract, Hyaluronic Acid, Pentylene Glycol, Sodium Metaphosphate, Silica Dimethyl Silylate, Cyclodextrin, Tocopherol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Madecassoside, Hydrogenated Poly(C6-20 Olefin), Protease, Ascorbyl Tetraisopalmitate, Glutathione, Achillea Millefolium Extract, Hdi/Trimethylol Hexyllactone Crosspolymer, Beta-Carotene, Ferulic Acid...The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-After cleanser + toner and before cream, take a few drops and smooth evenly onto entire face and neck. .-Gently pat in for better absorption. .-Use AM and PM. .-Layer with sunscreen in the AM...Recycling Instructions:.-Visit terracycle.com/en-us/brigades/innisfree to sign up for free..-Log into your TerraCycle account at terracycle.com to download and print a free shipping label..-Gather all your clean, empty innisfree products and place them in a box to ship..-Drop off at your local shipping provider and weu2019ll do the rest.

reviews.review_title: Glow Up with Innisfree Green Tea Enzyme Vitamin C
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Innisfreeu2019s Green Tea Enzyme Vitamin C Brightening Serum is a lightweight, refreshing formula that enhances skin radiance. Infused with green tea and vitamin C, it targets dark spots and uneven skin tone, promoting a brighter, more luminous complexion. The serum absorbs quickly without feeling greasy, leaving skin smooth and refreshed. Ideal for brightening and revitalizing dull skin, it delivers noticeable results with consistent use, making it an essential addition to any skincare routine.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Iu2019ve been using the Green Tea Enzyme Vitamin C Brightening Serum for a few weeks now, and Iu2019m quite pleased with the results overall! My skin looks brighter and more even-toned, with a noticeable glow after just a few days of use. The serum absorbs quickly, and it doesnu2019t leave any greasy or sticky residue, which is a big plus for me.  The scent is subtle and fresh, and I really appreciate the antioxidant-rich green tea and vitamin C combo. However, I did experience a bit of irritation around my sensitive areas, like under my eyes, the first couple of times I applied it. It wasnu2019t unbearable, but I had to be careful to avoid those spots, and I started using it less frequently to give my skin time to adjust. After a few days, the irritation subsided, and I was able to use it regularly without any further issues.  I would still highly recommend this serum to anyone looking to brighten their skin and get an even complexion, but if you have sensitive skin like mine, you might want to patch test first or ease into daily use.

reviews.review_title: Gave me dermatitis, not recommended at all!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product gave me severe dermatitis. I wouldn't say my skin was overly sensitive before, just slightly more acne prone so I was always careful using new products. But thanks to this product, I now am dealing with the worst my skin has ever been and I am not sure it will ever fully recover. I did spot test before, and I was fine originally, and then after a few weeks of using it fully on my face I broke out into hives wherever I put the product, and my face was is swollen! I am sure it was due to this product, as I stopped using all skincare for a month, and then slowly got back into my routine one product at a time. Within a few hours of applying this serum for the first time since the original outbreak, my eyes were swollen shut! Definitely do not recommend!

reviews.review_text: Innisfree's Green Tea Enzyme Vitamin C Brightening Serum combines the refreshing power of green tea with the brightening effects of Vitamin C, making it a promising product for anyone looking to achieve radiant, hydrated skin. reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: After hearing so much about the benefits of Vitamin C for the skin, I decided to take the plunge with Innisfree's Vitamin C serum, and let me tell you, it did not disappoint! From the moment I started incorporating it into my daily skincare routine, I noticed significant changes in my complexion.  The serum comes in a sleek, easy-to-use bottle, and the texture is just divine. It's lightweight, absorbs quickly, and doesn't leave any sticky residue, making it perfect for both my morning and evening routines. I have sensitive skin, so I'm always cautious about introducing new products, but this serum was gentle yet effective.  Within a few weeks, I started to see a noticeable difference in my skin's texture and tone. My complexion appears brighter, more radiant, and the dark spots from past acne scars are visibly reduced. It's as if my skin has a new lease on life!  What I appreciate the most about Innisfree's Vitamin C serum is its formulation. It's packed with natural ingredients, and being from a brand known for its commitment to sustainability, it feels good to support a company that cares about the environment as much as it does about skincare.  If you're on the fence about trying a Vitamin C serum, I couldn't recommend this product enough. It's a game-changer for anyone looking to brighten their complexion and even out their skin tone. Innisfree has truly outdone themselves with this serum, and it's a staple in my skincare routine now. Thank you, Sephora, for carrying such a fantastic product!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I recently tried the Green Tea Enzyme Vitamin C Brightening Serum and I have to say, I am absolutely blown away by how amazing it is. This product has quickly become a staple in my skincare routine and I can't imagine my skincare routine without it.  First of all, the ingredients in this serum are top-notch. Green tea is known for its antioxidant properties, which help to fight off free radicals and protect the skin from environmental damage. Vitamin C is an essential nutrient for the skin, helping to brighten and even out the skin tone. The combination of these two ingredients in this serum is truly a powerhouse for skin health.  The texture of the serum is lightweight and absorbs quickly into the skin. It doesn't leave any sticky or tacky residue behind, which is a huge plus in my book. I love how it feels on my skin and how easily it works into my routine.  After using this serum for a few weeks, I have noticed a significant improvement in the overall brightness and clarity of my skin. My complexion looks more even and radiant, and my skin tone is more balanced. I have also noticed that any dark spots or hyperpigmentation I had have started to fade away. My skin looks healthier and more youthful than ever before.  I also appreciate that this serum is cruelty-free and made with natural ingredients. It gives me peace of mind knowing that I am using a product that is good for my skin and good for the environment.  Overall, I cannot recommend the Green Tea Enzyme Vitamin C Brightening Serum enough. It has truly transformed my skin and I will continue to repurchase it for as long as I can. If you're looking for a serum that will brighten and rejuvenate your skin, look no further than this amazing product.

reviews.review_text: Overview: The Innisfree Green Tea Enzyme Vitamin C Brightening Serum is a promising addition to my skincare routine. It boasts a blend of green tea extract, vitamin C, and enzymes, targeting to brighten and even out skin tone while providing hydration and antioxidant protection.  Texture & Scent: The serumu2019s gel-like texture is lightweight and absorbs quickly, leaving no greasy residue. Its subtle citrus scent is pleasant and uplifting, perfect for a refreshing skincare experience.  Performance (after one week): After incorporating this serum into my routine for just one week, Iu2019ve noticed a subtle improvement in my skinu2019s radiance and texture. While itu2019s too early to see dramatic results, my skin feels smoother and appears slightly brighter.  Results (anticipated): Iu2019m optimistic that with continued use, the serum will help fade dark spots and hyperpigmentation, leading to a more even complexion. Iu2019m also looking forward to experiencing its long-term brightening effects.  Final Thoughts: Overall, the Innisfree Green Tea Enzyme Vitamin C Brightening Serum shows promise in brightening and improving skin texture. Although itu2019s early days, Iu2019m hopeful that with consistent use, it will deliver noticeable results. I look forward to seeing how my skin continues to improve with this serum. Gifted by innisfree

Innisfree is one of my tried, tested, and true brands! reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product for free in exchange for a review.  If you're new to the world of vitamin C, you can't go wrong trying the Vitamin C Green Tea Enzyme Brightening Serum.  With a dropper to allow for precise control and application, a few drops is what you need for your face and neck. The serum itself is lightweight, clear, and friendly to those of us with oily skin. It absorbs quickly into the skin, and most importantly, it doesn't leave behind any greasy residue or oiliness. In addition, it has no scent, so you can freely layer on additional products if needed.  Now, in terms of its star ingredient, vitamin C: It has worked well to help brighten my complexion. I can visibly see the reduction in redness, blemishes, and other minor marks. However, when it comes to a significant reduction in dark spots or hyperpigmentation, the verdict is still out. I haven't noticed any of the darkest of sunspots disappearing, but that may also be because it takes literally months for hyperpigmentation to fade via tropical methods. It's why it is important to have patience and play the long game when it comes to this factor.  Another thing to note is that this serum is strong, so I wouldn't recommend applying it three or four nights in a row. Start by using it twice a week and gradually bump up the usage to three and then four times a week as your skin's tolerance levels grow.
